crypto.name: BitFlip1
crypto.desc: Flip bits and decrypt communication between Bob and Alice.

crypto.name: BitFlip2
crypto.desc: Flip bits and decrypt communication between Bob and Alice, but this time Bob is not so talkative.

crypto.name: BitFlip3
crypto.desc: Flip bits and decrypt communication between Bob and Alice, but this time Bob is not so talkative and primes are stronger.

pwn.name: BitmapManager
pwn.desc:
Here's a software solution that meets all of your image management needs! It was written in C++ to achieve the highest levels of performance, but worry not, we have enabled some of the latest and greatest compiler options to ensure that memory corruption is not a concern.

The service is running at bitmap-manager.hackable.software:4141. The flag is in the "flag.txt" file.

pwn.name: Heap-Hop
pwn.desc:
CTF without a heap challenge is not a CTF, right?
Take the glibc from Ubuntu 20.04:
4db473e38da06f7b1ad54ef117a184e08ffda27bbbb5329d03831186e3e533c8 /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6

pwn.name: no-eeeeeeeeeeeemoji
pwn.desc:
Variation on the theme of 0ctf's eeemoji.
This challenge is running on Ubuntu 18.04.

nc noemoji.hackable.software 1337

FYI: libc version is 2.27-3ubuntu1.2 (SHA1: a22321cd65f28f70cf321614fdfd22f36ecd0afe)

rev.name: RetroZeit
rev.desc: Just wait for the flag. Works on AmigaOS 3.x (workbench).

web.name: Scratchpad
web.desc: Yet another notepad web challenge. Mind getting the flag?

web.name: harmony chat
web.desc:
Our Harmony Chat is securer than Discord for sure!

P.S. Flag is in <TaskDirectory>/flag/<RandomFileName>
P.S.2. The server is expected to crash frequently. Keep your exploits stateless. This is not part of the challenge - this is just reality.
P.S.3. Server-side is using NodeJS v14.

http://harmony-1.hackable.software:3380/
http://harmony-2.hackable.software:3380/
http://harmony-3.hackable.software:3380/

Note: All hosts above are identical, it's just manual load balancing.

Source: harmony.zip
Update: We've added minor Firefox compatibility fixes after the CTF start to match the deployed version. No major changes, so it's optional to re-download.
